item.title: Ninth teen charged over ‘sadistic’ attack
item.description: A ninth teenager has been charged over the “sadistic” attack of a man who had his face repeatedly slashed and his head stomped on in the Sydney suburb of Pyrmont on Friday night.

item.title: Fury over anti-masker’s ‘disgusting attack’
item.description: Victoria’s chief police commissioner has torn into anti-maskers who think they’re above the law, slamming the foolish behaviour as “unacceptable, selfish and an arrogant approach”.

item.title: ‘Get real’: ScoMo blasts lockdown objectors
item.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison has condemned people “sovereign citizens” and anti-maskers who are deliberately defying Australia’s coronavirus restrictions.

item.title: Melbourne hit with rare snow
item.description: Melbourne’s CBD is shivering through snowlike conditions this morning after experiencing a rare snowfall as an icy blast crossed the state.

item.title: COVID-19 case at Sydney child care centre
item.description: A new case of COVID-19 has been linked to a day care centre in Sydney’s south west.

item.title: Free face masks: one woman’s mission
item.description: Taped to a fence in a quiet street on Brisbane’s southside are 20 face masks, carefully sewn and individually wrapped.

item.title: RBA keeps cash rate at historic low
item.description: The Reserve Bank of Australia has kept the official cash rate at a historically low level of 0.25 per cent.

item.title: Boy allegedly brags about attack in texts
item.description: A Sydney schoolboy allegedly sent sickening texts describing in “minute detail” the gruesome injuries he and his mates inflicted on a stranger they bashed and stabbed in the face, a court has heard.

item.title: Upbeat investors push up Aussie shares
item.description: The Australian share market closed almost 2 per cent higher after rallies in the US and Europe overnight, and as commodity prices remain strong.

item.title: Quarantine loophole to slam shut
item.description: Queensland has taken a tough stance to close the loophole allowing consular staff to bypass COVID-19 quarantine rules.
